metadata.name: Synapse Workspaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Synapse Workspace.
Required. Workspace active directory administrator type.
Required. Login of the workspace active directory administrator.
Required. Object ID of the workspace active directory administrator.
Optional. Tenant ID of the workspace active directory administrator.
The synapse workspace administrator's interface.
Required. The name of the firewall rule.
Required. The start IP address of the firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.
Required. The end IP address of the firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format. Must be greater than or equal to startIpAddress.
The synapse workspace firewall rule's interface.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS Zone Group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS Zone Groups to associate the Private Endpoint. A DNS Zone Group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, the deployment will use the latest version available at deployment time.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
An AVM-aligned type for a customer-managed key. To be used if the resource type does not support auto-rotation of the customer-managed key.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if only logs are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if only user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Required. The subresource to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "blob", "table", "queue" or "file" for a Storage Account's Private Endpoints.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specify if you want to deploy the Private Endpoint into a different resource group than the main resource.

An AVM-aligned type for a private endpoint. To be used if the private endpoint's default service / groupId can NOT be assumed (i.e., for services that have more than one subresource, like Storage Account with Blob (blob, table, queue, file, ...).
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the Synapse Workspace.
Optional. The geo-location where the resource lives.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Enable or Disable AzureADOnlyAuthentication on All Workspace sub-resource.
Optional. AAD object ID of initial workspace admin.
Required. Resource ID of the default ADLS Gen2 storage account.
Required. The default ADLS Gen2 file system.

Optional. Create managed private endpoint to the default storage account or not. If Yes is selected, a managed private endpoint connection request is sent to the workspace's primary Data Lake Storage Gen2 account for Spark pools to access data. This must be approved by an owner of the storage account.
Optional. The Entra ID administrator for the synapse workspace.
Optional. The customer managed key definition.
Optional. Activate workspace by adding the system managed identity in the KeyVault containing the customer managed key and activating the workspace.

Optional. Workspace managed resource group. The resource group name uniquely identifies the resource group within the user subscriptionId. The resource group name must be no longer than 90 characters long, and must be alphanumeric characters (Char.IsLetterOrDigit()) and '-', '_', '(', ')' and'.'. Note that the name cannot end with '.'.
Optional. Enable this to ensure that connection from your workspace to your data sources use Azure Private Links. You can create managed private endpoints to your data sources.
Optional. The Integration Runtimes to create.
Optional. Allowed AAD Tenant IDs For Linking.
Optional. Linked Access Check On Target Resource.
Optional. Prevent Data Exfiltration.
Optional. Enable or Disable public network access to workspace.
Optional. List of firewall rules to be created in the workspace.
Optional. Purview Resource ID.
Required. Login for administrator access to the workspace's SQL pools.
Optional. Password for administrator access to the workspace's SQL pools. If you don't provide a password, one will be automatically generated. You can change the password later.
Optional. The account URL of the data lake storage account.
Optional. Git integration settings.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(variables('userAssignedIdentitiesUnion'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]

properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('customerManagedKey'))), createObject('cmk', createObject('kekIdentity', if(not(empty(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'))), createObject('userAssignedIdentity', extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '//'), '/')[2], split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '////'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities', last(split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), 'dummyMsi'), '/')))), createObject('useSystemAssignedIdentity', empty(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId')))), 'key', createObject('keyVaultUrl', reference('cMKKeyVault::cMKKey').keyUri, 'name', parameters('customerManagedKey').keyName))), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Synapse Workspace Integration Runtimes
metadata.description: This module deploys a Synapse Workspace Integration Runtime.
Conditional. The name of the parent Synapse Workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the Integration Runtime.
Required. The type of Integration Runtime.
Conditional. Integration Runtime type properties. Required if type is "Managed".

resources.name: [format('{0}/{1}', parameters('workspaceName'), parameters('name'))]
resources.properties: [if(equals(parameters('type'), 'Managed'), createObject('type', parameters('type'), 'managedVirtualNetwork', createObject('referenceName', 'default', 'type', 'ManagedVirtualNetworkReference'), 'typeProperties', parameters('typeProperties')), createObject('type', parameters('type')))]

metadata.description: The name of the Resource Group the Integration Runtime was created in.
The name of the Integration Runtime.
The resource ID of the Integration Runtime.

metadata.name: Synapse Workspaces Keys
metadata.description: This module deploys a Synapse Workspaces Key.
Required. The name of the Synapse Workspaces Key.
Conditional. The name of the parent Synapse Workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Used to activate the workspace after a customer managed key is provided.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
The name of the deployed key.
The resource ID of the deployed key.
The resource group of the deployed key.

metadata.name: Synapse Workspaces Administrators
metadata.description: This module deploys Synapse Workspaces Administrators.
Conditional. The name of the parent Synapse Workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Workspace active directory administrator type.
Required. Login of the workspace active directory administrator.
Required. Object ID of the workspace active directory administrator.
Optional. Tenant ID of the workspace active directory administrator.
The name of the deployed administrator.
The resource ID of the deployed administrator.
The resource group of the deployed administrator.

metadata.name: Synapse Workspaces Firewall Rules
metadata.description: This module deploys Synapse Workspaces Firewall Rules.
Conditional. The name of the parent Synapse Workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the firewall rule.
Required. The start IP address of the firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.
Required. The end IP address of the firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format. Must be greater than or equal to startIpAddress.
The name of the deployed firewall rule.
The resource ID of the deployed firewall rule.
The resource group of the deployed firewall rule.

name.value: [coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'name'), format('pep-{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service, copyIndex()))]

parameters.privateLinkServiceConnections: [if(not(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'isManualConnection'), true())), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'privateLinkServiceConnectionName'), format('{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service, copyIndex())), 'properties', createObject('privateLinkServiceId', resourceId('Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces', parameters('name')), 'groupIds', createArray(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service))))), createObject('value', null()))]
parameters.manualPrivateLinkServiceConnections: [if(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'isManualConnection'), true()), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'privateLinkServiceConnectionName'), format('{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service, copyIndex())), 'properties', createObject('privateLinkServiceId', resourceId('Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces', parameters('name')), 'groupIds', createArray(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service), 'requestMessage', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'manualConnectionRequestMessage'), 'Manual approval required.'))))), createObject('value', null()))]

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string.

Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Required. The name of the private link service connection.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string array `[]`.
Required. The resource id of private link service.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.
Required. Properties of private link service connection.
Required. The name of the private link service connection.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string array `[]`.
Required. The resource id of private link service.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.
Required. Properties of private link service connection.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource. Used when the network admin does not have access to approve connections to the remote resource.
Optional. A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone configurations of the private DNS zone group. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The custom DNS configurations of the private endpoint.
The IDs of the network interfaces associated with the private endpoint.
The group Id for the private endpoint Group.
The resource ID of the deployed Synapse Workspace.
The name of the deployed Synapse Workspace.
The resource group of the deployed Synapse Workspace.
The workspace connectivity endpoints.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The private endpoints of the Synapse Workspace.
